comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: mydrive.ch
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.mydrive.ch/browse](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.mydrive.ch%2Fbrowse) ### Comment > This cloud storage website, even though I have a "premium" subscription, flicks through their product portfolio every 12 seconds or so in the bottom left corner, which is very distracting while concentrating on working on files in the center of the screen. Since it is only visible while logged-in, I've made two screenshots with one being uBlock's rule generator, to see the path of the images. The number in brackets changes every 12 seconds by images being rotated, with the rule "www.mydrive.ch##.softronics-products" I was able to hide the banner without further breakage. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/tSlk9YF.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/TazK57g.png)

comment.body:
@Alex-302 I've run into the same issue as described by me above back in 2020, this time though on the "sister website" `www.mystorbox.de`. It is a carbon copy of `mydrive.ch` (only differing in the domain and the server location), including the mentioned "self-promotion slideshow" on the left hand side of the screen. The filter rule you've added for `mydrive.ch` still works as intended over there, so it probably could be re-used for this site as well.

![mystorbox](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23747593/228426598-64e84584-cab1-41a3-b67d-254ace850a96.JPG)

Desktop

_No response_

comment.body:
Maybe need convert rule to user script (to cover uBo fans by TamerMonkey/ViolentMonkey) or uBo custom scriptlet (without second WebExtension).

It's unlikely that anyone will spend several days figuring out how to use, for example, `set-constant` 
 to fool the site into thinking that we don't give consents.

AdGuard may in the future rewrite this into its delayed-click scriptlet, so it won't need to be added to AdGuard Extra. The uBo in that case will have to wait to see if the simulate-event-poc (https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uBlock-issues/issues/2229) will be in the uBo available to all and if not if they will make an exception to close on one Luxembourg site with rejection of consents.

labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

1.42.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

o.savecall.de

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Self-destruction of first-party cookies, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide Referrer from third-parties (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Mask your IP address (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Protect from DPI

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. I work for a IT company and sales just asked me th CNAME a tracking link for them to [date.wcheck.org](http://date.wcheck.org/) Pls block that link right away

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> Where are these domains used?

Usable in Mails for tracking the times opend and watched (For users using services like Gmail in  the Webinterface a danger)
And posbibly for tracking users on Websites, i do not no witch and even if i wold not know  i can't tell you.
Since a CNMAE arguably is not a company secret i told you, but i stretches the boundries of my contract allready.
You see https://comx.io/en/home it is a tool for Tacking unknowing customers do you need more reason to block?

Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Not reproduced it with AdGuard Base.
AdGuard Mobile Ads is needed only for mobile sites.
EasyList is not required, because it's a part of the AdGuard Base.

comment.body: I'm glad that it works fine on your end. You are welcome :)

Seems that the condition about `.rightCol` is not necessary. Try without it. For instance, the rule below

```adblock
asianage.com#%#AG_onLoad(function(){document.body.innerHTML=document.body.innerHTML.replace(/ADVERTISEMENT/g,'');});
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://r3.o.lencr.org](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fr3.o.lencr.org) ### Comment Username: @Ultrabenosaurus > This domain is a legitimate domain maintained by Let's Encrypt for their certificate validation. It seems AdGuard's safe search / anti-malware filter catches it, which prevents HTTPS certificate validation. It has been previously flagged by malicious "security reputation" services but should have been around long enough by now to avoid new false positives. issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.notion.so/personal](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.notion.so%2Fpersonal) ### Comment Username: @FluffCycle > Clicking between the tabs on the highlighted section with AdGuard enabled causes a significant lag in the browser and the content switching. Scrolling down in the page seems to be worse as well when the extension is enabled. Other pages on the Notion website seemed to be affected too but I noticed it the most here. > > Through enabling and disabling extensions I was able to narrow it down to AdGuard appearing to cause it. Once I disable all AdGuard extensions in Safari settings and refresh the page, I'm able to interact with it quickly/smoothly as expected. > > I noticed in activity monitor that the 'https://www.notion.so' process appears to use more CPU with AdGuard enabled vs not (~30% more from what I can tell on my Mac) ### Screenshots

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -272,6 +272,8 @@ kat.*,kickass.*,kickass2.*,kickasstorrents.*,kat2.*,kattracker.*,thekat.*,thekic
 !
 !
 !
+! https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/146786
+asianage.com#%#AG_onLoad(() => { var element = document.querySelector('.rightCol'); if ( typeof element.innerHTML !== 'undefined' ) { element.innerHTML = element.innerHTML.replaceAll('ADVERTISEMENT', ''); } });
comment.body:
I think that it would be better to check if element exist, something like:
```adblock
asianage.com#%#AG_onLoad(() => { var element = document.querySelector('.rightCol'); if ( element ) { element.innerHTML = element.innerHTML.replaceAll('ADVERTISEMENT', ''); } });
```
otherwise there will be an error in console (if there will be not `.rightCol`), it happens for example here - `https://www.asianage.com/search`

Not reproduced it with AdGuard filters.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).
